availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Meade county Sct
3rd February 1862.
"The resignation of John Chism Senr a Justice of this County was on this day produced in Court and ordered to be entered of record, reading as follows Towit,
I John Chism Sr do hereby resign my Office as Justice of the Peace of Meade County in District No 7. and desire that this resignation may be entered of record this 3rd February 1862

John Chism Sr
By Abraham Chism.

It is therefore Considered and so adjudged that the office of Justice as heretofore filled by said Chism has become vacant, by reason of said resignation; The Court therefore recommends to his Excellency B McGoffin Governor of this Commonwealth Abraham Chism as a suitable person to fill said vacancy from this time until the next and ensuing general August Election in District No 7. on Wolf Creek."

A Copy
Att Wm Fairleigh Clerk
Meade County Court

Abraham Chism
Recommended as Justice of The Peace for Meade County
District No. 7.
